fileheader.author: Richard Harrison
fileheader.note: Built using VSPAERO. The basic form is built from a single wing with varying cambers to roughly match the shape of the aircraft. A set of degen geometry is required for the control surfaces, flaps and tanks, together with the elevator positions. These are all then processed and this data is built from the results (together with the -stab to get the derivatives)
Aircraft origin for measurements is the nose

F-15C in the critical aft c.g. configuration has a weight of 33,467 pounds and a c.g. location at 563.1 inches (6:12). To convert c.g. location in inches to percent mean aerodynamic chord, the following equation is used for all A through D models of the F-15: (measurements in inches). % MAC = (xcg - 408.1 * 100) / 191.33

reference.author: Richard Harrison, rjh@zaretto.com
reference.title: F-15 Aerodynamic data built from vspaero; CG (10.5, 0, 0) M
